408. Lee (Mrs. John Smith)
SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as any other. Some of the questions will apply to most everyone; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaires.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: MRS. JOHN SMITH LEE

2. Your address: HAZEL COLLEGE

3. Date: 1/19/46

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): JOHNSON GLASGOW SCOTLAND

5. What was your father's name and occupation?: MILL MANAGER

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): 1885 MAY

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc.): I was 10 years old

9. What were your reasons for coming West?: My family had quota a large family of children living in Canada from Scotland.

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Rail road or government information?): Of old and new world stories.
